resources: getSubTaxa --ncbiTaxId 5833 --outputFile @dataDir@/taxonIdFile createPropFile --file @dataDir@/dbest.prop --propList "dbestLogin:@dbestLogin@,dbestPswd:@dbestPswd@" --span 500 --taxonFile @dataDir@/taxonIdFile --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --soVer @soVer@ --dbestLoginFile dbest.prop --dbestConnect "dbi:Oracle:dbst100n" Plasmodium ESTs from dbEST. gunzip @dataDir@/pfc.fasta.gz --sourceIdRegex ">(\w+)" --fastaFile @dataDir@/pfc.fasta --externalDatabaseName %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --SOTermName 'EST' --ncbiTaxId 36329 --libraryStrain '3D7' --libraryStage 'Asexual stage' --libraryVector 'pOTB7b' --contactName 'Malcolm Gardner' --contactAddress1 'Seattle Biomedical Research Institute' --contactAddress2 '307 Westlake Avenue N., Suite 500 Seattle, WA 98109-5219' --libraryName 'Zhang/Gardner Pf 3D7 mixed asexual' --libraryDesc "CDNA was prepared from polyA+ RNA using the SMART cDNA Library Construction Kit and was cloned into the pOTB7b vector, a derivative of pOTB7 (1.8 kb) in which a SfiI stuffer fragment was inserted between the BamHI and XhoI sites of pOTB7.PFOCB48 indicates plate and well. T indicates dye terminator chemistry. F and R indicates M13 forward and reverse primers.The R primer is at the 3' polyA end of the mRNA." Hanbang Zhang and Malcolm Gardner P. falciparum 3D7 mixed asexual stage EST library. --sourceIdRegex "\|(\w+\(\S+\))$" --fastaFile @dataDir@/reffull_pf.fas --externalDatabaseName %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --SOTermName 'transcript' --ncbiTaxId 36329 --libraryStrain '3D7' --libraryVector 'pME18SFL3' --contactName 'Junichi Watanabe' --contactAddress1 "Institute of Medical Science; The University of Tokyo, Department of Parasitology" --contactAddress2 "4-6-1, Shirokanedai, Minatoku, Tokyo 108-8639, Japan" --putativeFullLength --libraryName 'derivedFromWatanabePf3D7_cultured' --libraryDesc "Predicted full length transcript sequence produced after BLAT alignment of the WatanabePf3D7_cultured EST library sequences to the genome and correction of the cDNA sequences using annotated gene sequences." P. falciparum ESTs, FcB1 strain, Erythrocytic stages, schizont/merozoite stage library, from GenoScope. --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --mapFile isf/PlasmoDB/PfalciparumEmbl2gus.xml --inputFileOrDir @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION% --inputFileExtension "embl" --fileFormat embl --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Plasmodium falciparum 3D7" --seqSoTerm "chromosome" --validationLog validation.log --bioperlTreeOutput bioperlTree.out Sequence data from GeneDB for P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The new annotation for P. falciparum 3D7 genome started in October 2007 with a weeklong workshop co-organized by staff from the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute (WTSI) and the EuPathDB team. The Wellcome Trust and Burroughs Wellcome Fund-sponsored workshop was held in Hinxton, UK and was attended by nearly 30 Plasmodium researchers contributing expertise in various aspects of Plasmodium biology, plus more than 10 bioinformatics support staff from the Artemis, GeneDB and EuPathDB teams. Ongoing annotation and error checking is being carried out by the GeneDB group from WTSI. P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. Ongoing annotation and error checking is being carried out by the GeneDB group from WTSI. @dataDir@/data.exchange/$f.fixed; cat @dataDir@/data.exchange/$f.fixed | perl -pe 's/MAL(\d+ standard)/Pf3D7_0$1/' | perl -pe 's/Pf3D7_01([01234] standard)/Pf3D7_1$1/' | perl -pe @dataDir@/fixed --fileFormat embl --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Plasmodium falciparum 3D7" --naSequenceSubclass ExternalNASequence --seqIdColumn source_id --seqExtDbName %PARENT_EXT_DB_NAME% --seqExtDbRlsVer %PARENT_EXT_DB_RLS_VER% Sequence data from GeneDB for P. falciparum 3D7 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format generated at the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, TIGR/NRMC, and Stanford University. This data has sequence updates for chromosomes 6, 7 , 8 and 13. For more information see the GeneDB 3D7 News Archive. Includes sequence updates to TIGR chromsomes 2, 10, 11 and 14. Originally described in Gardner et al. Nature 419:498, 2002. Also includes centromere features and curated Gene Ontology and E.C. number associations to genes. --tries=5 --mirror --no-parent --no-directories --no-host-directories --cut-dirs=6 --output-document=gene_association.GeneDB_Pfalciparum.20080403 --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --inputFile @dataDir@/gene_association.GeneDB_Pfalciparum.20080403 --goExternalDatabaseSpec "GO_RSRC|@GO_VER@" --seqIdSql "SELECT regexp_replace(g.source_id,'_v5.5$',''), taf.aa_sequence_id FROM dots.genefeature g, dots.transcript t, dots.translatedAAFeature taf WHERE g.na_feature_id = t.parent_id AND t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id and g.source_id like '%v5.5'" --targetTable "DoTS::TranslatedAASequence" --lineOfEvidence "Annotation Center" --inputIdColumn id --tolerateMissingSeqs P. falciparum Gene Ontology associations assigned by GeneDB. (\d+)|" --tableName "DoTS::MotifAASequence" --logFrequency 100 --regexTaxonName "\|.*\|(.*)" --regexName "\|(.*)\|.*" IEDB epitopes. Pberghei.eu hosts a database containing information on genetically modified rodent malaria parasite lines generated by many labs worldwide. Specifically, it contains data of three rodent malaria parasite species; Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of genetically modified malaria parasites. The database not only provides information on 'successful' mutants with a clear phenotype, but also (un)published mutants without a clear phenotype and (un)published negative trials to disrupt genes. --DbRefMappingFile @dataDir@/gene2pubmed_08_14_09.tab --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbReleaseNumber %RESOURCE_VERSION% --columnSpec "primary_identifier,secondary_identifier" --tableName "DbRefNAFeature" DBRefs for Entrez pubmed links. --DbRefMappingFile @dataDir@/gene_info_plasmo --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbReleaseNumber %RESOURCE_VERSION% --columnSpec "primary_identifier,secondary_identifier,remark" --tableName "DbRefNAFeature" @dataDir@/sangerItGhanaSnps.gff rm -f @dataDir@/sangerPfalciparumSnps.tar.gz --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Based on whole genome sequence for strains Ghana1 and IT $currDir=`pwd`; cd @dataDir@ ; tar -xzf @dataDir@/sangerPReichenowiSnps.tar.gz; cd $currDir sangerSnps2Gff.pl --sf @dataDir@/WTSI_PFAL.Preich.0.dbsnp.new --cf @dataDir@/Preich.uniq.hq.nr3.gff.ORA --s Sanger --r 3D7 > @dataDir@/sangerPreichenowiSnps.gff --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Based on whole genome sequence for P. reichenowi_Oscar suSnpTabToGffTransform --tab_file @dataDir@/Pf_snps_allChromosomes.in --out_file @dataDir@/Su_SNPs.gff --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Based on CDS sequences from strains 3D7, 7G8, D10, Dd2, HB3 gunzip @dataDir@/broad_snps.gff.gz mv @dataDir@/broad_snps.gff @dataDir@/Broad_SNPs.gff --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Based on whole genome sequence for strains Dd2 and HB3, and partial genome sequence for multiple strains gunzip @dataDir@/combinedSnps.gff.gz mv @dataDir@/combinedSnps.gff @dataDir@/plasmoDbCombinedSnps.gff --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" SNPs generated by combining all SNP data for P. falciparum from the Broad Institute, NIH, and Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute sqlLoader.pl --file @dataDir@/map_v6.0.sql --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --tries=5 --no-directories --no-host-directories --cut-dirs=3 convertWinzelerGeneticVarToGff --input_file @dataDir@/SFPdata_1.tab.txt --strain 7G8 --strain D6 --strain W2 --strain HB3 --strain Dd2 --strain FCR3 --strain FCB --strain C188 --strain 18.02 --strain 31.01 --strain 41.02 --strain 48.02 --strain 51.02 --output_file @dataDir@/WinzelerGeneticVariationArray.gff --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Based on whole genome arrays for 14 field and laboratory strains of P. falciparum (kindly provided by E. Winzeler, Scripps Research Institute). --sequenceFile @dataDir@/derisi_oligos.fsa --externalDatabaseName %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseVersion %RESOURCE_VERSION% --soTermName "oligo" --regexSourceId ">(\S+)" --tableName "DoTS::ExternalNASequence" --logFrequency 100 --ncbiTaxId 36329 Version 2 of microarray oligos printed on MOS11 (HB3 study) and MOS14 (Dd2/3D7 studies) from Joe DeRisi (UCSF). Oligos were obtained from Manuel Llinas (Princeton). preLoadArrayDesign --category TechnologyType --value @PlasmoSageTags.OntologyEntryValue@ --manufacturer @PlasmoSageTags.Contact@ awk -F:::: 'x++; x==1{print "tag\n" $1}' @dataDir@/array/distinct_sage_tags.txt > @dataDir@/array/distinct_sage_tags_header.txt --cfg_file @dataDir@/array/sageArray.config --data_file @dataDir@/array/distinct_sage_tags_header.txt --manufacturer @PlasmoSageTags.Contact@ --technology_type @PlasmoSageTags.OntologyEntryValue@ Serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE) was applied to the malarial parasite P. falciparum. --contact @PlasmoSageTags.Contact@ --arrayDesignName 'P.falciparum SAGE Tags' --arrayDesignVersion '1' --studyName 'Transcriptional profile of P.falciparum by Serial analysis of gene expression' --studyDescription '' --freqFile @dataDir@/freqs.tsv Frequencies of SAGE tags that were observed in studies using RNA from P. falciparum. --interactionFile @dataDir@/interaction_dataset.txt Protein interaction network for P. falciparum derived from yeast two-hybrid studies obtained from Doug LaCount (Purdue). --DbRefMappingFile @dataDir@/plasmomap_dbrefs.txt --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbReleaseNumber %RESOURCE_VERSION% --columnSpec "remark" --tableName "DbRefNAFeature" Using a number of computational and experimental functional genomics datasets, we have reconstructed the functional interaction network of the human malarial parasite P. falciparum. Network data and associated queries are available at the plasmoMAP website. --interactionFile @dataDir@/above-2-links --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbVersion %RESOURCE_VERSION% Using a number of computational and experimental functional genomics datasets, we have reconstructed the functional interaction network of the human malarial parasite P. falciparum. Network data and associated queries are available at the plasmoMAP website. --ProfileSetDescription 'The phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum' --headerFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/pf_TaxonNameHeaders --dataFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/pfalciparum/pp-any-and-pfal.gz --tolerateMissingIds 1 --dontLoadScores Phylogenetic profiles based on the presence or absence of all known P. falciparum ORFs in 164 completely sequenced genomes were calculated. Similarity between profiles is a good indicator of functional linkages between proteins (see Pellegrini et al., 1999). Data on ORFs with the most similar profiles to a given query ORF is also available, and can be used to establish the function of uncharacterized ORFs, based on the similarity of their profiles (see Date and Marcotte, 2003) with ORFs of known function. --ProfileSetDescription 'The phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum' --threshold "0.558" --dataFile @dataDir@/pp-any-and-pfal.noHomologs.mi --tolerateMissingIds 1 Mutual information, an entropy based, information theoretic measure, was used to measure similarity between phylogenetic profiles. This measure is more sensitive, and can detect inverse or non-linear relationships, as opposed to using simpler metrics such as Pearson correlation (Date and Marcotte, 2003). P. falciparum chromosome IDs to GenBank accession numbers. --DbRefMappingFile @dataDir@/2009-05-12.txt --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbReleaseNumber %RESOURCE_VERSION% --columnSpec "remark" --tableName "DbRefNAFeature" PASA alignments of EST sequences. --tries=5 --mirror --no-parent --no-directories --no-host-directories --cut-dirs=4 --output-document=ecMappings.txt cut -s -f 1,6 @dataDir@/ecMappings.txt &> @dataDir@/Pfid.txt --ECMappingFile @dataDir@/Pfid.txt --evidenceCode "Hagai Ginsburg" --aaSeqLocusTagMappingSql "SELECT aa_sequence_id FROM dots.GeneFeature g, dots.Transcript t, dots.TranslatedAAFeature taf WHERE g.source_id = ? @dataDir@/Pf_merozoite_peptides_shahid_kahn.tab --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --geneExternalDatabaseSpec 'Pfalciparum_chromosomes_RSRC|@Pfalciparum_chromosomes_VER@' This data was provided by the Leiden Malaria Group (prepublication from Dr. Shahid Khan). Mass spec data was generated from P. falciparum merozoites. --inputFile @dataDir@/Lasonder_MOSQUITO_STAGES_Oocyst.tab --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --geneExternalDatabaseSpec 'Pfalciparum_chromosomes_RSRC|@Pfalciparum_chromosomes_VER@' Mass Spec of Mosquito oocysts by Edwin Lasonder lab --inputFile @dataDir@/Lasonder_MOSQUITO_STAGES_Oocyst-derived.tab --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --geneExternalDatabaseSpec 'Pfalciparum_chromosomes_RSRC|@Pfalciparum_chromosomes_VER@' Mass Spec of Mosquito oocyst-derived sporozoites by Edwin Lasonder lab --inputFile @dataDir@/Lasonder_MOSQUITO_STAGES_Salivary.tab --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --geneExternalDatabaseSpec 'Pfalciparum_chromosomes_RSRC|@Pfalciparum_chromosomes_VER@' Mass Spec of Mosquito salivary gland sporozoites by Edwin Lasonder lab gunzip @dataDir@/Evigan_pf_nbest_chr_forImport.gff.gz --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --mapFile isf/TIGRGffFeatures2gus.xml --inputFileOrDir @dataDir@/Evigan_pf_nbest_chr_forImport.gff --fileFormat gff2 --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Plasmodium falciparum 3D7" --gff2GroupTag "GenePrediction" --naSequenceSubclass ExternalNASequence --seqIdColumn source_id --handlerExternalDbs --seqExtDbName "P.falciparum_chromosomes" --seqExtDbRlsVer @pfChromosomeVer@ Evigan is a eukaryotic gene predictor which produces consensus gene models by integrating multiple sources of evidence. Evigan can incorporate various types of evidence such as gene models predicted by gene finders, EST matches, protein-to-genome alignment, etc. Employing a Dynamic Bayesian Network(DBN), Evigan makes predictions by infering the most likely consensus gene models given observed source evidence. Its model parameters are estimated by the Expectation-Maximization(EM) algorithm, eliminating the need of curated training data. Click here to get more information. updateEviganSecondaryScore.pl --evigan_ext_db_rls_spec "Evigan_RSRC|@Evigan_VER@" --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --inputFile @dataDir@/broad_barcode_plasmodb.txt The Genotyping Barcode is based on 24 different high frequency SNPs (minor allele frequency > 30%) in P. falciparum. These were selected from whole genome sequencing and affymetrix genotyping of P. falciparum strains from around the globe. The method itself uses the TaqMan SNP genotyping assay. --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --inputFile @dataDir@/3K_plasmo.txt The 3K genotyping chip is an affymetrix array containing ~3000 SNPs (about two thirds are from chromosome 7 and the rest are distributed throughout the genome). --extDbName %RESOURCE_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %RESOURCE_VERSION% --inputFile @dataDir@/75K_plasmo.txt --SOTermName 'SNP' 75k SNP chip data from the Broad. There appear to be ~17500 informative snps. --inDir @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION% --outDir @dataDir@ --outputFile Pfal_MAPP-version3.sql --table ApiDB.plasmoMapp --verbose MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor) recognises transcription start sites using 21 physicochemical properties of DNA. The predictor is comprised of a series of support vector machines which were trained on the 5' ends of full-length cDNAs from the FULL-Malaria database. Optimal prediction performance is achieved using only predictions with a MAPP score > 0.90. Predictions are strand specific. (Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E). sqlLoader.pl --file @dataDir@/../BrickMAPPpromoters/Pfal_MAPP-version3.sql --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" MAPP (Malaria Promoter Predictor) recognises transcription start sites using 21 physicochemical properties of DNA. The predictor is comprised of a series of support vector machines which were trained on the 5' ends of full-length cDNAs from the FULL-Malaria database. Optimal prediction performance is achieved using only predictions with a MAPP score > 0.90. Predictions are strand specific. (Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E). --inputDir @dataDir@/Dd2 --configFile @dataDir@/Dd2/config.txt --dudProfilesFile @dataDir@/Dd2/dud_oligos.txt --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% Expression data for the P. falciparum DD2 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF). --inputDir @dataDir@/3D7 --configFile @dataDir@/3D7/config.txt --dudProfilesFile @dataDir@/3D7/dud_oligos.txt --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% Expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF). --inputDir @dataDir@/HB3 --configFile @dataDir@/HB3/config.txt --dudProfilesFile @dataDir@/HB3/dud_oligos.txt --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% --tolerateMissingIds Expression data for the P. falciparum HB3 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF). Described in Bozdech et al. PloS Biology 1:E5, 2003. doTranscriptExpression.pl --xml_file @dataDir@/transcript_expression_config.xml --inputDir @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION% --configFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/config.txt --tolerateMissingIds --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% Cell cycle expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain generated by the Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute). doTranscriptExpression.pl --xml_file @dataDir@/transcript_expression_config.xml --inputDir @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION% --configFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/config.txt --tolerateMissingIds --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% Gametocyte expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain generated by the Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute). --studyName 'Molecular mechanism for switching of P.falciparum invasion pathways into human erythrocytes' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory %RESOURCE_VERSION% The malaria parasite, P. falciparum, exploits multiple ligand-receptor interactions, called invasion pathways, to invade the host erythrocyte. Strains of P. falciparum vary in their dependency on sialated red cell receptors for invasion. We show that switching from sialic acid-dependent to independent invasion is reversible and depends on parasite ligand utilisation. Expression of reticulocyte-binding like homologue 4 (PfRh4) correlates with sialic acid-independent invasion and PfRh4 is essential for switching invasion pathways. Differential activation of PfRh4 represents a novel mechanism of invasion pathway control and provides P.falciparum with exquisite adaptability in the face of erythrocyte receptor polymorphisms and host immune responses. (taken from GEO record GSE2878) --studyName 'P.falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION% Expression profiling of 3D7 silent information regulator 2 homolog (Sir2) knockout at ring stage, 8 hours post-invasion. Results identify Sir2-mediated, reversible heterochromatin silencing as one tier of epigenetic regulation of the antigenic variation var gene family. (taken from GEO record GDS1350) --studyName 'Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites suggests a hierarchy of molecular interactions' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION% Analysis of reticulocyte binding-like homolog 2b (PfRh2b) null mutant 3D7 parasites. D10 isolate naturally lacks PfRh2b. Silencing of PfRh2b, a key invasion ligand, leads to altered invasion receptor dependency. Results provide insight into the molecular basis for invasion via an alternate pathway. (taken from GEO record GDS2346) --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" doTranscriptExpression.pl --xml_file @dataDir@/transcript_expression_config.xml --inputDir @dataDir@/profiles/ --configFile @dataDir@/profiles/config.txt --tolerateMissingIds --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported custom made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7. doTranscriptExpression.pl --xml_file @dataDir@/transcript_expression_config.xml --inputDir @dataDir@/analysis --configFile @dataDir@/analysis/config.txt --analysisResultView 'DataTransformationResult' To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported cust om made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7. --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fifteen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DNA/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w, PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other variant gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones while the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcriptional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics. --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --inputDir @dataDir@/profiles/ --configFile @dataDir@/profiles/config.txt --tolerateMissingIds --externalDatabase %RESOURCE_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %RESOURCE_VERSION% Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establ ishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones ( 3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fif teen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 c ompared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DN A/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w , PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other varian t gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of tran scripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones whil e the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcrip tional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics. --DbRefMappingFile individuals was cultured to examine patterns of mature-stage gene expression in patient isolates. Statistical estimation of cell-cycle progression and lineage commitment in Plasmodium falciparum reveals a homogeneous pattern of transcription in ex vivo culture, data provided by Chris I. Newbold, Weatherall Institute of Molecular Medicine, Molecular Parasitology Group. --inputFile @dataDir@/P.falciparum_Clinical_Proteomics.tab --externalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" --geneExternalDatabaseSpec 'Pfalciparum_chromosomes_RSRC|@Pfalciparum_chromosomes_VER@' Data produced by proteomics analysis of clinical isolates of early stages of P. falciparum. Patient derived malarial parasites were directly processed and analyzed using shotgun proteomics approach using high sensitivity mass spectrometry for protein identification. Utpal Tatu, Department of Biochemistry, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, karnataka, India. --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" ChIP-on-chip profiling of H3, H3K4me3, H3K9me3, and H3K9ac of P. falciparum from asynchronous parasites revealed an extensively euchromatic epigenome with heterochromatin restricted to variant surface antigen gene families (VSA) and a number of genes hitherto unlinked to VSA. Contact Henk Stunnenberg, h.stunnenberg@ncmls.ru.nl, NCMLS Radboud Universiteit. --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Chromatin immunoprecipitation to identify histone modifications (H3K9me3, H3K9Ac, H3K4me3, H4K20me3) in Plasmodium falciparum wild type and Sir2 knock-outs. Contact Artur Scherf, artur.scherf@pasteur.fr, Unit de Biologie des Interactions Hte-Parasite. --dbRefExternalDatabaseSpec "%RESOURCE_NAME%|%RESOURCE_VERSION%" Genome-wide association of Pf Heterochromatin protein 1 (Hp-1) with virulence gene clusters. We identified 425 PfHP1-bound genes by ChIP-on-CHIP - almost all of which code for expor ted (predicted) virulence genes including all var genes, rifs, stevor, pfmc-2tm and others.
